summary: This document is a chain of emails between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel discussing the handling of Touhy requests from an Epstein victim for documents related to the Epstein investigation. It reveals internal coordination on document production, legal strategy regarding materials from other districts, and the identification of a victim as Maria Lacerda.

persons.name: Steven Kochevar
persons.context: Primary drafter and point person for responding to Touhy requests from Epstein victims; coordinates with the criminal team and other offices.

persons.name: John McEnany
persons.context: Reviewer and approver of Touhy request responses; provides legal guidance on jurisdictional and procedural issues.

persons.name: David Jones
persons.context: Consulted on the approach to handling Touhy requests; mentioned as agreeing with a proposed strategy.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: Criminal AUSA involved in the Epstein case; works with Steven Kochevar on victim requests and communicates with victim's counsel.

persons.name: Sarah
persons.context: Referred to as a 'wiser Touhy head' in the Civil Division to be consulted on complex Touhy referral issues.

persons.name: Roberta Kaplan
persons.context: Attorney for an Epstein victim (plaintiff) making the Touhy request; recipient of initial procedural letter.

persons.name: Maria Lacerda
persons.context: Identified in an email as the 'Jane Doe' victim who submitted a Touhy request; subject of immunity discussions in SDFL.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier at the center of the investigation; subject of the document requests from victims.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: Signed off on a Touhy response letter and document production.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Signed off on a Touhy response letter and document production.

connections.description: Frequent email correspondence regarding the review and approval of Touhy request responses and legal strategy.
Collaborate on handling victim requests; Alex is the criminal AUSA providing case knowledge, Steven handles civil communications.
Kaplan is identified as counsel for the victim Maria Lacerda, who is making the Touhy request.
Both are AUSAs in SDNY; Jones's opinion on a Touhy approach is noted by Kochevar to McEnany.

events.title: Updated Touhy Response Letter Sent
events.description: Steven Kochevar sends John McEnany an updated letter responding to a Touhy request from an Epstein victim, approved by the 'Maxwell team'.

events.title: Identification of Jane Doe as Maria Lacerda
events.description: John McEnany confirms in an email that the 'Jane Doe' victim who submitted a Touhy request is Maria Lacerda.

events.title: Establishment of Touhy Request Process
events.description: Internal discussion establishes Steven Kochevar as the point person for civil plaintiff/victim Touhy requests related to Epstein, with criminal AUSAs providing support.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY was handling Touhy requests from Epstein victims seeking documents for civil litigation.
A victim previously referred to as 'Jane Doe' in a Touhy request is explicitly identified as Maria Lacerda in an internal email.

The SDNY office possessed FBI investigative files from the SDFL Epstein investigation but deliberately avoided obtaining files from the SDFL U.S. Attorney's Office due to conflict and discovery concerns.
Internal debate occurred over whether to refer requesters to the Northern District of Georgia for SDFL materials, as NDGA had 'stepped into the shoes' of SDFL for Epstein matters.
The 'Maxwell team' (presumably prosecutors in the Ghislaine Maxwell case) signed off on a version of a response letter to a victim's Touhy request.
